alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Schoharie County through 300 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Breakabeen, or 10 miles southeast of Cobleskill, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Middleburgh, Schoharie, Breakabeen, Livingstonville, Sagendorf Corners, Zucks Corners, Watsonville, Greenbush, West Berne, Huntersland, Old Stone Fort, West Fulton, West Middleburgh, East Cobleskill, Bramanville, Vintonton, Mineral Springs, Patria, Barnerville and Howes Cave. This includes Interstate 88 near exit 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
